newsitem.title: USA: Armstrong World says court sets hearing date.
newsitem.headline: Armstrong World says court sets hearing date.

text.p: Armstrong World Industries Inc said Wednesday a U.S. District Court set a September 9 hearing for a preliminary injunction to prevent the closing of the deal announced by Sommer Allibert SA of France and Tarkett of Germany.
Armstrong also said it is formally requesting that Sommmer and Tarkett disclose documents relating to the proposed deal.
On May 28, Tarkett and Sommer announced their plan to consummate their merger, which includes Sommer's interest in Domco Inc during the fourth quarter of 1997.
On June 9, Armstrong announced its offer for all oustanding shares of Domco at $23 per share. It revised the offer July 2.

Armstrong said it recently filed a complaint and a motion for preliminary injunction seeking to prevent the Sommer-Tarkett deal based upon a breach of a confidentiality agreement and the unauthorized use of Armstrong's confidential information to attract and structure the deal.
